source_name: Seroprevalence of Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome Coronavirus-2 (SARS-CoV-2) Infection Among VA Healthcare System Employees Suggests Higher Risk of Infection When Exposed to SARS-CoV-2 Outside of the Work Environment

summary: Veterans Affairs Ann Arbor Healthcare system studied employees of a Veterans Affairs healthcare system (n=1476) in Ann Arbor Michigan and found a seroprevalence of 4.9% (95% CI 3.8%-6.1%).

source_name: 1 in 7 Russians Have ‘Coronavirus Immunity’ – Official
lead_organization: Russian National Council for Combating Coronavirus

test_not_linked_reason: Not enough test information reported to match

subgroup_specific_category: Overall, positive on RBD IgG ELISA
source_name: SARS-CoV-2 Serologic Assays in Control and Unknown Populations Demonstrate the Necessity of Virus Neutralization Testing

sample_frame_info: Unclear - just says "Group B subjects were randomly recruited from the community with unknown exposure to or infection with SARS-CoV-2. "
numerator_definition: Antibody-positive samples were designated as any samples with an AUC above the mean + 3 SDs of the AUCs of the negative control samples on the ELISA.

source_name: Seroprevalence of anti-SARS-CoV-2 of IgG antibody by ELISA: Community-based, cross-sectional study from urban area of Malegaon, Maharashtra.
summary: The Municipality of Malegaon studied a community-based sample (n=336) and found a seroprevalence rate of 40%.
source_publisher: Journal of family medicine and primary care
sample_frame_info: The community-based cross sectional study was conducted in total 98 closed containment zones demarcated by Municipal Corporation, Malegaon. The study was conducted from 25 July to 20 Aug 2020. Approval of the Shri Bhausaheb Hire Government Medical College, (SBHGMC, Dhule) Institutional Ethics committee (IEC) was obtained prior to commencement of the study. Written informed consent was obtained prior to data collection, Data collection tools were prepared with the help of WHO community-based serosurvey for anti-SARS-CoV-2 IgG antibody detection in community.

numerator_definition: The test results were read after 15 min. When no control line appeared or if the reading chamber was discoloured by blood the test was repeated. Test results were binary and read by the individual participant, assisted by local staff if needed. Instructions on how to read the results were posted online, in a video instruction, and sent by email to all participants. Inconclusive test results were treated as negative unless otherwise stated.
